svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 30, 2023" date: "2023-09-29"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video. Recap by Tim Beiko.Â Notes from
Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Devnet-9 using EIP4788 mainnet address & manual
deployment and plan to test MEV-Boost; KZG ceremony trusted setup expected next week
EIP7514 (max churn limit) to be tested on short lived devnet-10 with high number of
validators EIP4788 (beacon root) issues fixed from 3 audits: 0 timestamp & ring buffer
size Discussion on proposed EIP7503 (onchain privacy via reminting burnt ETH)
Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video. Recap by Tim Beiko.Â Notes from Tim
Beiko and Christine Kim :
* Devnet-9 using EIP4788 mainnet address & manual deployment and plan to test
MEV-Boost; KZG ceremony trusted setup expected next week
Devnet-9 using EIP4788 mainnet address & manual deployment and plan to test MEV-Boost;
KZG ceremony trusted setup expected next week
* EIP7514 (max churn limit) to be tested on short lived devnet-10 with high number of
validators
* EIP4788 (beacon root) issues fixed from 3 audits: 0 timestamp & ring buffer size
EIP4788 (beacon root) issues fixed from 3 audits: 0 timestamp & ring buffer size
* Discussion on proposed EIP7503 (onchain privacy via reminting burnt ETH)
Discussion on proposed EIP7503 (onchain privacy via reminting burnt ETH)
* Devnet-9 launched
Devnet-9 launched
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.23% far too close to risky 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.23% far too close to risky 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~80%
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any
client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~80% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth ~80% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Need more geographic diversity for both stakers & nodes , particularly outside of
US/Can/EU
Need more geographic diversity for both stakers & nodes , particularly outside of
Layer 1
* 91% of blocks are via MEV-Boost relays controlled by just four entities
91% of blocks are via MEV-Boost relays controlled by just four entities
* Censorship dashboard : OFAC compliance of validators, relays & builders
Censorship dashboard : OFAC compliance of validators, relays & builders
* Mempool dumpster (transactions in Parquet & CSV): adds inclusion status & inclusion
delay
Mempool dumpster (transactions in Parquet & CSV): adds inclusion status & inclusion
Client releases for HoleÅ¡ky testnet
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.5.0 : experimental QUIC support Lodestar v1.11.3
Nimbus v23.9.1 Prysm v4.1.0-alpha.1 Teku v23.9.1 : HoleÅ¡ky testnet requires GLIBC v2.34
on Linux
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v4.5.0 : experimental QUIC support
Lighthouse v4.5.0 : experimental QUIC support
* Lodestar v1.11.3
Lodestar v1.11.3
* Nimbus v23.9.1
Nimbus v23.9.1
* Prysm v4.1.0-alpha.1
Prysm v4.1.0-alpha.1
* Teku v23.9.1 : HoleÅ¡ky testnet requires GLIBC v2.34 on Linux
Teku v23.9.1 : HoleÅ¡ky testnet requires GLIBC v2.34 on Linux
* Execution layer: Besu v23.7.3 Erigon v2.49.3 : HoleÅ¡ky; v2.50.0 : implements Cancun
EIPs Geth v1.13.2 : fixes for path db storage schema corner cases Nethermind v1.21.0 :
executable renaming, throttling RPC calls, Trie recovery & sync time reduction Reth
v0.1.0-alpha.9 : implements Cancun EIPs, revm state handling API reworked and pruning
improvements; v0.1.0-alpha.10 : HoleÅ¡ky
Execution layer:
* Besu v23.7.3
Besu v23.7.3
* Erigon v2.49.3 : HoleÅ¡ky; v2.50.0 : implements Cancun EIPs
Erigon v2.49.3 : HoleÅ¡ky; v2.50.0 : implements Cancun EIPs
* Geth v1.13.2 : fixes for path db storage schema corner cases
Geth v1.13.2 : fixes for path db storage schema corner cases
* Nethermind v1.21.0 : executable renaming, throttling RPC calls, Trie recovery & sync
time reduction
Nethermind v1.21.0 : executable renaming, throttling RPC calls, Trie recovery & sync
* Reth v0.1.0-alpha.9 : implements Cancun EIPs, revm state handling API reworked and
pruning improvements; v0.1.0-alpha.10 : HoleÅ¡ky
Reth v0.1.0-alpha.9 : implements Cancun EIPs, revm state handling API reworked and
Research
* Preparing for danksharding: data visualization on the propagation time of big blocks
on mainnet
Preparing for danksharding: data visualization on the propagation time of big blocks
* Relay-constructed inclusion list : proposal for censorship resistance in MEV-Boost
Relay-constructed inclusion list : proposal for censorship resistance in MEV-Boost
* Framework for design of optimal dynamic fees for multiple resources
Framework for design of optimal dynamic fees for multiple resources
Layer 2
* OP Stack: social decentralization & Fault Proof VM and dispute games
OP Stack: social decentralization & Fault Proof VM and dispute games
* Roll-op : script to configure & deploy OP Stack network
Roll-op : script to configure & deploy OP Stack network
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs EIP7525 : Expire state of the inactive accounts
EIPs
* EIP7525 : Expire state of the inactive accounts
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7524 : PLUME signature in wallets ERC7526 : Onchain NFT
royalty enforcement
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7524 : PLUME signature in wallets
ERC7524 : PLUME signature in wallets
* ERC7526 : Onchain NFT royalty enforcement
ERC7526 : Onchain NFT royalty enforcement
Stuff for developers
* HoleÅ¡ky testnet launched for staking, infrastructure & protocol testing Explorers:
Etherscan , beaconcha.in & Otterscan 1000 holETH distributed to contract deployers
(mainnet & Goerli testnet) Faucets: pk910 PoW faucet & Etherscanâ€™s Blockscan chat
Replacement for deprecated Goerli Use Sepolia testnet for app layer testing
HoleÅ¡ky testnet launched for staking, infrastructure & protocol testing
* Explorers: Etherscan , beaconcha.in & Otterscan
Explorers: Etherscan , beaconcha.in & Otterscan
* 1000 holETH distributed to contract deployers (mainnet & Goerli testnet)
1000 holETH distributed to contract deployers (mainnet & Goerli testnet)
* Faucets: pk910 PoW faucet & Etherscanâ€™s Blockscan chat
Faucets: pk910 PoW faucet & Etherscanâ€™s Blockscan chat
* Replacement for deprecated Goerli
Replacement for deprecated Goerli
* Use Sepolia testnet for app layer testing
Use Sepolia testnet for app layer testing
* Remix v0.36.0 : uses ChatGPT to explain a function, generate documentation & explain
compiler errors, adds more quick fixes and support for Ephemery testnet
Remix v0.36.0 : uses ChatGPT to explain a function, generate documentation & explain
* Hardhat v2.17.4 : supports debug_traceCall
Hardhat v2.17.4 : supports debug_traceCall
* Branching Tree Technique examples : specification framework for writing structured
Solidity tests
Branching Tree Technique examples : specification framework for writing structured
* Solmate (contract library) adds ERC6909 (minimal multi-token interface)
implementation
Solmate (contract library) adds ERC6909 (minimal multi-token interface) implementation
* SSTORE gas: OpenZeppelin ReentrancyGuard avoids resetting to zero to maximize gas
refund EVM uses SSTORE current vs final value and not intermediate values for reduced
gas cost
SSTORE gas:
* OpenZeppelin ReentrancyGuard avoids resetting to zero to maximize gas refund
OpenZeppelin ReentrancyGuard avoids resetting to zero to maximize gas refund
* EVM uses SSTORE current vs final value and not intermediate values for reduced gas
cost
EVM uses SSTORE current vs final value and not intermediate values for reduced gas cost
* Comparison of borrowing protocol architectures : MakerDAO, Compound, Aave, Euler &
Yield
Comparison of borrowing protocol architectures : MakerDAO, Compound, Aave, Euler &
* Huffathon challenges: 1 , 2 , 3 & 4
Huffathon challenges: 1 , 2 , 3 & 4
* wagmi v2 alpha : TanStack Query support, connect multiple connectors, switch chains
while disconnected and EIP6963 support
wagmi v2 alpha : TanStack Query support, connect multiple connectors, switch chains
* ERC4337 (account abstraction): Permissionless.js : TypeScript library to interact
with bundlers & paymasters, built on viem Alchemyâ€™s Rundler : ERC4337 bundler in Rust
ERC4337 (account abstraction):
* Permissionless.js : TypeScript library to interact with bundlers & paymasters, built
on viem
Permissionless.js : TypeScript library to interact with bundlers & paymasters, built on
viem
* Alchemyâ€™s Rundler : ERC4337 bundler in Rust
Alchemyâ€™s Rundler : ERC4337 bundler in Rust
* Solidity Next.js starter v2 : uses Hardhat, viem, wagmi, Tailwind CSS & RainbowKit
Solidity Next.js starter v2 : uses Hardhat, viem, wagmi, Tailwind CSS & RainbowKit
* Ether binder beta, PHP utilities to interact with Ethereum, uses PHP 8.2
Ether binder beta, PHP utilities to interact with Ethereum, uses PHP 8.2
* Curta CTF Philosopher's Stone writeup
Curta CTF Philosopher's Stone writeup
* Guide to using Cryo & Polars for data analysis
Guide to using Cryo & Polars for data analysis
* Banteg: create heatmap of ERC20 transfers
Banteg: create heatmap of ERC20 transfers
* RareSkills: Circom tutorial
RareSkills: Circom tutorial
Security
* SEAL 911 members saved $200k from Dice9win mid exploit
SEAL 911 members saved $200k from Dice9win mid exploit
* GMX (DEX on Arbitrum) price skew vulnerability disclosed , fixed with $1M bounty paid
GMX (DEX on Arbitrum) price skew vulnerability disclosed , fixed with $1M bounty paid
Ecosystem
* Dankrad: Ethereum values need to be protected by the community , they are not
automatically guaranteed by economic incentives
Dankrad: Ethereum values need to be protected by the community , they are not
* EF data collection grants , applications close October 23, wish list includes
projects for XATU (network monitoring), testnets and data collection
EF data collection grants , applications close October 23, wish list includes projects
for XATU (network monitoring), testnets and data collection
* ERC4337 (account abstraction) adoption analysis : 687k wallets, 2M UserOps, majority
of wallets used 5 times or less
ERC4337 (account abstraction) adoption analysis : 687k wallets, 2M UserOps, majority of
wallets used 5 times or less
* ETHGlobal New York hackathon finalists
ETHGlobal New York hackathon finalists
Enterprise
* Bank of International Settlements Project Mariana : proof of concept for cross-border
exchange of wholesale CBDCs using AMMs on Sepolia testnet
Bank of International Settlements Project Mariana : proof of concept for cross-border
* Buenos Aires digital identity : QuarkID wallet can be used to claim birth & marriage
certificates, uses zkSync Era
Buenos Aires digital identity : QuarkID wallet can be used to claim birth & marriage
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.5 to 74.1 gwei, with 10.7 gwei average Negative
issuance currently at 20.9 gwei 7.9k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 5.5 to 74.1 gwei, with 10.7 gwei average
* Negative issuance currently at 20.9 gwei
Negative issuance currently at 20.9 gwei
* 7.9k ETH net issuance this week
7.9k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $1,569 - $1,684, currently $1668
ETHUSD : $1,569 - $1,684, currently $1668
* ETHBTC : currently 0.062 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.062 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Arbitrum Odyssey relaunched, 7 week campaign for users to try apps & collect badges
Arbitrum Odyssey relaunched, 7 week campaign for users to try apps & collect badges
* Pudgy Toys : physical Pudgy Penguin plushies, sold in Walmart, licensing royalties
shared with NFT holders, purchasers can claim a Forever Pudgy on zkSync
Pudgy Toys : physical Pudgy Penguin plushies, sold in Walmart, licensing royalties
* Nouns DAO burn proposal : incentivize spending the treasury otherwise excess ETH can
be burnt
Nouns DAO burn proposal : incentivize spending the treasury otherwise excess ETH can be
burnt
* Paris Hilton promoting MareBear NFTs : Tamagotchis pets
Paris Hilton promoting MareBear NFTs : Tamagotchis pets
Job Listings
* Aave seek a UX Engineer and a Staff Rust Engineer
Aave seek a UX Engineer and a Staff Rust Engineer
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
* EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit).Â Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* VanEck announced upcoming ETH futures ETF (EFUT)
VanEck announced upcoming ETH futures ETF (EFUT)
* Coinbase approved by Bermuda Monetary Authority to offer perpetual futures trading,
non-US
Coinbase approved by Bermuda Monetary Authority to offer perpetual futures trading,
* New York & Boston Feds: stablecoin flight to safety dynamics resemble money market
funds
New York & Boston Feds: stablecoin flight to safety dynamics resemble money market
* Chase UK will decline crypto related payments
Chase UK will decline crypto related payments
General
* Exchange hacks: $200M for Mixin Network and $8M for HTX (formerly Huobi)
Exchange hacks: $200M for Mixin Network and $8M for HTX (formerly Huobi)
* Sigmabus : efficient computation of elliptic curve group operations in generic SNARK
circuits
Sigmabus : efficient computation of elliptic curve group operations in generic SNARK
* Naysayer proofs : accept proofs optimistically and only check when necessary
Naysayer proofs : accept proofs optimistically and only check when necessary
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-30-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Oct 5-6 â€“ ETHMilan conference
Oct 5-6 â€“ ETHMilan conference
* Oct 6-27 â€“ ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6-27 â€“ ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Oct 6-8 â€“ ETHRome hackathon
Oct 6-8 â€“ ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 13-15 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 13-15 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 21 â€“ Ethereum MÃ©xico
Oct 21 â€“ Ethereum MÃ©xico
* Oct 22-24 â€“ ETH Hong Kong
Oct 22-24 â€“ ETH Hong Kong
* Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH London hackathon
Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH London hackathon
* Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH Miami festival & hackathon
Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH Miami festival & hackathon
* Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH Vietnam
Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH Vietnam
* Oct 28-30 â€“ Paradigm CTF
Oct 28-30 â€“ Paradigm CTF
* Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
* Nov 3-5 â€“ ETHBrno
Nov 3-5 â€“ ETHBrno
* Nov 3-5 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon
Nov 3-5 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 13-19 â€“ Devconnect (Istanbul)
Nov 13-19 â€“ Devconnect (Istanbul)
* Nov 16-19 â€“ Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 16-19 â€“ Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
* Dec 4-5 â€“ ETHVenice
Dec 4-5 â€“ ETHVenice
* Dec 8-10 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHIndia (Bangalore)
Dec 8-10 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHIndia (Bangalore)
